text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly identifies that under Article 9(5), if an authorized officer has reason to believe a vessel is not complying with the Convention, they may seek to obtain the necessary information from the vessel. This is stated clearly in Section III: 'Under Article 9(5), if an authorized officer \"has reason to believe that a vessel of any Contracting Party is not complying with the provisions of the Convention, he may identify the vessel, seek to obtain the necessary information from the vessel and report.\" The Belgian officers had reason to believe that a Convention violation was occurring\u2014namely, the unmarked anchored lines\u2014and were therefore fully within their authority to identify the Spanish vessel and seek to obtain the necessary information.'", "criterion_id": "criterion 3"}
